modules.description: Provides functions to serialize primitive values, tuples, and variant types into XML elements, with error handling. Operates on custom output type representing XML elements and error type for serialization failures. Used to generate XML representations of structured data, such as converting a record with named fields into an XML node with attributes.

Provides functions to serialize and deserialize OCaml values into and from formats like JSON, XML, and binary. It operates on arbitrary data types including records, variants, lists, and tuples. Used to persist complex data structures to disk or transmit them over networks efficiently.

Serializes structured data into XML elements, supporting primitives, tuples, and variants with error handling. It uses a custom output type for XML structure and an error type to track serialization issues. Operations include converting records into XML nodes with attributes and handling complex data transformations. Examples include generating XML from a list of integers or a variant type with nested fields.
